My host and i felt the Price was absolutely worth the money (not in the lover end though) but the food, aquavites and the service deserter the Price.

 And not least. Staff Very ‚ÄúCorona-focussed‚Äù to clean the tablets when guests had left. In our opinion absolutely Living up to the instructions set by the authorities.

Was here on a christmas party with my colleagues in december 2016, 
We had ordered their christmas menu, with wine, and was all pleasantly surprised of how good everything was. The food is typically Danish, with a modern twist. Mouthwateringly good, SO well presented, and the wine just topped it all off. By far the best restaurant experience i've had in Odense. Would recommend this place to everyone! This is a "Must try" in Odense!

We were 5 that went for a Friday evening meal to celebrate a graduation. We had booked the table in advance and notified the kitchen about a food allergy which was instantly asked about by the waiter, very good and thoughtful service that was consistent throughout the meal. All 5 of us decided to go for the menu with 3 courses. Everything was delicious, well prepared and came quickly. The selection of wine and beer was good, but unfortunately they were out of espresso. What a lovely place that cares about using local food and cooking it to a high standard :-)

The restaurant was not very busy, which surprises me, as the servie was full of charm and the cooking perfectly judged. The tastes were distinct (the root vegetable accompying the fish was perfect), the presentation correct and well balanced. The menu was simple and short, but would please all palates. Special mention for the butters accompanying the warm tasty bread  - thyme butter was particularly well done. I did not have have the desert, choosing the cheese option, which was very good with balanced accompaniments (honeyed nuts as well as two types of jelly), but I feel the quality of the cooking would also have shone in the desert courses. 

I would visiit again if I was in Odense longer.

Restaurant Fynboen focuses mainly on typical dishes from the Island Funen (or at least Denmark) produced from locally grown vegetables and local meat. The dishes are served with a nice, modern gourmet twist. The perfect example is the dish "makrel i tomat" (mackerel in tomato), which is normally the name of canned mackerel in a tomato sauce. This dish actually involves a can being served in front of you, but when opened the most delightful smoked mackerel is inside. The menu is full of surprising treats. 
You can do 3 or 4 courses or go all the way with the "Odense Aafart" menu, where you're served 5 dishes with wine, coffee and sweets for 750 kr, which is more than reasonable.
For a new restaurant they got surprisingly many basic things right already. There was however some confusion about the constant lack of knives and forks. The presentations were ok, but the generosity was unmistaken. The place was cosy in a minimalist, Nordic way.

Recommended!

Small deliciouse tapas dishes served on a running belt. The consept is the same as runnig sushi but with tapas dishes. The service is great, the waiters were very nice and professional. You pay a reasonable 250 dkr for as much as you can eat. I highly recommend this place to everyone who enjoys good food and cosy surroundings.

The concept is based on 'running tapas', as in 'running sushi' just with tapas. At an all you can eat price of 250 kr, the big question is if quality can match. I believe it can. Most things are classic and simple, while there are also a lot of surprisingly delicate and creative things to try. 

I love the concept of 'seatings'. At Bar Tapas there are two seatings per day, 1730-1930 and again from 2000. This gives the opportunity to make a really good process in the servings starting with starter-like dishes, then mains and last desserts. This worked out fantastically!

Seeving was excellent and relaxed, so was the atmosphere. Great wine menu and some 'local' Spannish beers available.

All in all a great and smooth experience at a super reasonable price.

Amazing place! 18 different tapas in small bowls on a running belt through the restaurant. All of highest quality, both taste and presentation. Pick what you want and how much you want. Top experience!

An unexpected top experience, don't miss this place.

Convert "running sushi" to tapas and you get the idea. You just grab from the conveyor belt, what you feel like eating... and you eat a lot, because, the food is very nicely presented and taste very good. 
The restaurant has two seating's 17:30 and 20:00, and you kind of want to arrive at these hours, because they first put on "starters" ... turn to "mains" and finish up with "desserts". The drinks. Some ordered sangria, myself included.... not a fan of this recipe, but we also had a really nice home made fresh lemonade, that was good. One ordered a "sour" drink, that was a lot better, than the sangria. Wine card selection suitable for the food.
The interior is simple but nice. Small tables, if you are more than five people, I don¬¥t know, where to sit.
Good service, you gain piles of small bowls and they removed it rapidly.

Outstanding lunch in Odense Denmark with the bonus of the cafe being in the heart of their famous Harry Potter celebration held this time of year. Located on a narrow cobblestone alley in the heart of the city,  service and food were both superb. Burgers and chicken on a stick were excellent and as an added bonus, they served appetizers prior to the meal, something that rarely happens in Denmark. As an added bonus, noticed they were using the Lavu ordering system which was invented and manufactured in my hometown of Albuquerque, New Mexico. Great people watching from their window side tables made for a great lunch.

Last November, we discovered Wokshop on a drizzling, grey day. It was a perfect day for some Pad Thai and curry. We were pleasantly surprised to find that we didn't feel the need to add any hot sauce to our dishes. The contrast of the crunchy, fresh vegetables on saucy Pad Thai noodles was delicious. The curry had subtle levels of flavour. If you go at lunch, there are some dishes that are lunch sized and priced. The staff were very friendly and the chef was really nice as well. We'd go back-- oh, wait-- we did go back a few times while we were in Odense!

The food and service here is fantastic. We were looking for some good honest food in Odense and had been eating in Germany for a week and wanted a change. The Wok shop was just what we wanted. It was not cheap as we converted the bill to Australian Dollars but was worth it. The servings are large and full of good food.

Awesome place and awesome beers. The site of a former brewery, and they still brew 90% of their beers on site. Great choice with a good atmosphere and good food too. Reasonable prices with bands featuring now and again. Go and enjoy the wide selection of beers you won't be stuck for choice.

Anarkist Beer & Food Lab is a must visit place when visiting Odense. After 3pm you have access to a great, variated, and tasteful selection of different beers, light, dark, strong beers - you name it, it's there, beer of any kind of taste and color. While tasting the beers one can have a light meal of either burgers, fries, or different share foods. 
The place to visit if you like to experience another kind of pub/restaurante.

Went to the restaurant together with friends - Munch encouraged by the Nice pictures with White linen on the tablets and a cosy setting. 
We made a reservation in good time and were even reminded on SMS on the day, so we were quite disappointed when we arrived an were given the only table in the room with no tablecloth- and even worse- instead of chairs we were offered stools- chairs with no back. The waiter told us they were aware that tho owner wants the layout of the restaurant to include such poor seats. My comment is that if they can send out a reminder Sms they can also inform guests about any shortage of decent seating  

The personnel were aware - before our arrival - that we were heading for the 5 course menu which is not a 30 mins session. At the end we spent three and a half hours in uncomfortable seatings, and that is not good enough. 

The food...?

Actually good without being fantastic - wine menu was a bit disappointing with not much wine - or positive surprises.

All in all: based on the poor seating I will look for better option next week when I go out in Odense!

Final comment: during the last course the restaurant prepared for closure around us while we were eating - after spending this kind of money in a restaurant I expect more respect when eating.

There are things very hard to translate. One of them would be of taste, discovering the taste of a variety of delicious fresh sushi rolls. Another example would be the blissful laid-back environment of Seaweed. We had such a wonderful experience, you were all so kind, acommodating and friendly, that we really felt you brought "hygge" into our lives, inside the atmosphere was very homey. Food was simple, but surprinsingly inventive and very tasty. 30 Kr for such generous and delicious sushi rolls, it is definitely a steal from the culinary gods. I was a regular costumer of this restaurant. Paid a visit on sunday 10th of December 2017 around 16:25 o'clock with my sister for an afternoon tea. There was two waitresses one brunette and one blonde. We were received by the blonde hair waitress, she immediately asked us where we prefered to sit. We pointed at a 4 seats table by the window But she told us it wasn't possible for their restaurant politics. we had to sit at a 2 seats table. It was okay with us if that was Their politics. 
After 5 minutes comes a new couple in, They were received by The brunette waitress and placed at The same 4 seats table by window which we weren't allowed to sit at. I wondered this action so I asked The blond waitress Why it was so. My question made her uncomfortable and she immediately looked at The costumers sitting next to our table while she told us "That's because her Boss didn't told her colleague about their politic so She unfortunately couldn't Do anything for us and she just left".
I was like What!I didn't even ask her to Do anything for Me?? 
I couldn't Shake her attitude so we finished our hot chokolates very Quickly, paid and asked Them to wrap our cake to go. Since I couldn't accept The blond waitresses answer for an satisfying answer On our Way out I told her that I couldn't completely understand her last answer and this time she told Me That it wasn't her fault and again her Boss didn't inform her colleague to NOT give 4seats table to couples and she again couldn't Do anything for us!!!! 
Such a bad attitude, as a front person for a brand you shouldn't put the fault on your Boss or your colleague. You just should on behalf of your brand/staff apologize for The mistake from your side.
 In my case an apology would have been enough. Why The need to make your boss or colleague look bad.

I have been visiting their branch in Odense NV every now and then, can't be too often since the place is in the middle of nowhere, so when I saw that they just opened a new branch in what used to be Da Filippo restaurant, I was so happy since the location is just perfect. It is close from the city and just by the main road. 

I also like their new branch's interior much better than the last one. It look so chic and trendy, like any fast food joint you find in US. Cute.

We ordered take away (beware that this new establishment just opened in the beginning of the Nov '17 and based on their website, they haven't had a land line yet, so you just have to go there to check it out, either to dine in or to take out). 

I had New Mexico burger, and my partner has Chicago special, his came with 3x200gr burger with fries and coke for 95kr!!! That's a bargain and such a HUGE burger. Mine is 1x200gr and that was more than enough. Very very juicy burger, with fresh garlic spread and jalapenos for 59kr! I love it. We both love our burgers! 

This place is such a steal with an affordable price (in comparison with food in the near establishment that street food gone wrong with their pricing and sizing, where we ate several times and came back hungry and had to get another food to eat), and yes, if you are familiar with the area, you know which street food establishment I am talking about. almost and over 100kr burgers or dinner with such a small portion!!! sorry for my rant.

Back to Chicago Burger Buchwaldsgade, you really need to visit this place

I thought we were in for more of a traditionsl style meal, but it turned out to be a very interesting and surprising experience, which I can oly recommend others.

As I read the mostly positive reviews, we decided to go there for dinner.
When we entered, we were delighted by the cosy atmosphere and interior.
But then, it got weird. We are not fluent in Danish, so we spoke English, which wasn't a problem in Denmark until now. The waiter came to our table, looked at us, turned away and disappeared for a few minutes. Then he returned and took our order. We ordered a bottle of wine, which he just put on the table, without a comment. He did not let us taste it, or poured it to us.
He never looked at us, when he poured the single courses and it was more like he trough it on the table than really serving it. It was really rude, especially as he did small talk with all the other guests and we felt really uncomfortable.

To comment on the food: it was okay. The entree was good, especially the soup, but the main course was a disaster. The vegetables were either dry or not cooked at all and the meat was dry and there was no sauce at all, even though it was beef bourguignon, which usually has a great gravy.

We left after the main course and decided to enjoy drinks somewhere else, as we really felt unwanted and uncomfortable and we didn't want to take our chances with the dessert.
So I cannot recommend Palaeet. It was the worst dining experience I had in Denmark and will not go there again!

Cafe Victoria is located just inside Gate A, and in the part of the centre currently undergoing extensive renovations. Accordingly, access is somewhat difficult. However, the extra effort to reach this cafe is well worth it.

After a spot of shopping popped in for dinner with a lively two year old, good child's menu, spacious surroundings, staff speak good english. "Bobby", the Yugoslav owner and his wife have run this small family restaurant at the periphery of the Odense city centre for more than two decades, he told us (and can prove it with old photos on the wall).

The food is OK though definitely not as tasty as expected from the Balkan. I would suggest you take a grilled main course.

The service is (over?)attentive, Bobby is a chatty chap, no doubt. The atmosphere is homely with a number of tables occupied by regular guests.

You better book in advance. And bring cash! No credit cards here. A nuisance which emphasises the impression of a place which has been warped in time. As of 2013, Bergama has existed for 24 years on Vesterbro in Odense. Bergama is an unpretentious Turkish restaurant in modern (small) settings. The service is by young, very helpful and smiling waiters. The food, go for the buffet but they also have a la carte, is authentic local Turkish dishes, both warm and cold dishes are found in the buffet. There's a nice mix of vegetarian and meat dishes. The food is not Michelin-quality, but it is honest, not greasy, not pretentious, but simple food.

For the very low price of just 99 kr pr. buffet, this place is highly recommended as a local curiosity with great value for money.

A last note: Restaurants generally have a short life in Odense. When Bergama has existed in more than 20 years, this is not without a good reason.

At the corner of the City Hall (same building). I had very good (and beautiful) Danish open sandwiches for a nice price for lunch: 3 sandwiches for 99 DKK. Very happy with my choice for lunch! Would visit again.

Lovely courtyard in front of brewery serving fine dining. We had smoked salmon with quail egg and beef with chanterelles and sweet corn reduction. Apple pudding to die for. Whole card of amazing beers

Wery nice place, with exceptional bear list including own breewery products as well as options from other breeweries. We had a menu with additional selection of bear selected to match each of dishes. Excelent service.

Flakhaven is a local brewery and serves a lot of different beers, but from own production and Coisbo (another brewey on Funen) and US beer from Oregon. Location is very nice sitting outside in central Odense. Food is not top nutch. I had a classical wienerschnitzel with the traditional Danish style (capers, horseraddish, lemon and heering (although I prefer the variation with anchovies) fried potatoes and peas. The problem was the meat. A real wienerschnitzel is characterised by the fact that the meat has been beaten heavily before frying in order to have the fibers split and make the meat tender. This was not the case at Flakhaven where the meat was very hard. Service is very good.

Great food very cool place and nice beers, maybe a bit overpriced and a limited menu during week days (at least we were explained so) but we went for the steak to share and the meat was tasty and very tender also side dishes were quality!

Overall an excellent experience. Beers apart, the food is very good, and if you don't want beer for your dinner, the wine list provides well balanced choices at reasonable prices. Service is convincing and attentive.
Great beers, more than 20 draft beers. We alway take a break here when we are in Odense for business trip. Enjoy your perfect beer and relax yourself.

The staff is very nice and very pleased to help with selecting a beer.

I will start by saying that this restaurant is just a couple of houses up the street from ours and we just wanted to try everything that is on our street. So we decided to have a try for Mauritz's burgers. I ordered the one with chicken and curry sauce. I am not sure, why should that be a problem, but the chicken was just too plain. Tasted more like it was merely boiled in water and maybe with a pinch of salt and pepper. It was really difficult to eat it. Same goes for the size of the chicken - it was so thick, it was quite hard to take a bite. Anyways, the other burger was delicious - beef, cheese, nachos chips, jalapenos and sweet pickles. I just personally do not recommend ordering the chicken one. It was a waste of money. The service was good though and the interior is alright. Overall - I would like to try out another burger there and maybe write a better review!

Good selection of burgers with many taste variations. Not gourmet, but definitely not your average fast food either. Good value for the money, a great cosy atmosphere, and polite staff. Worth a visit, and great for quality fast food takeout. We visit regularly

The place is clean, friendly and offers value for money.

It was HUGE - my mouth couldn't get around it.  The ingredients - lettuce, tomato, cucumber and onion were fresh, the flavor delicious.

What  Ilike about their burger is that it is served in focaccia bread which is crispier that usuall soft burger bun. There is plenty of vegies too (tomato, salad, onion, cucumber) and good thick beef. Their homemade dressing that goes into all burgers is awsome :) At the cafe on the side one gets potato wedges with skin instead of fries, but at To Go you would need to order them separately. 
Regarding serving size I can tell that I have never been able to finish it, and I order the smller burgers. So it is a great tasting burger for good value, it's always on top of my mind if I want a burger.

Hand sanitize dispensers located right at the entrance and outside the rest rooms. There was a line at the door when we arrived but people were good at keeping distance. 

Great sushi and variety. As dinner progressed, less food was on the belt according to the decreasing amount of people dining. Nevertheless, the waiter came around to every table to ask if anything special was needed and encouraged us to let them know. Although we were full, the table next to us ordered some more and seemed happy with what they got. 

Would definitely recommend this place.
Highly recommed the buffet with drinks included. Have been there twice. Always a nice experience and good food.

Went to visit Kings on a Friday evening. The place were pretty full, but service still fine. Our son, who loves sushi (especially the unlimited kind), was thrilled and ate till we almost had to carry him home. From an adult perspective the quality were a bit more tepid, like these running sushis often are, but definately acceptable. The food often tend to be a bit assebly-line like, and that is a small turn off for me, but again my son loved it and the restaurant was his choise, and he would give it 4-5 stars. Price is fair.

There is a variaty of sushi, which is nice. There is also a little fruit that depends on the seasons.
The running sushi also has a running hot food section, which is lacking.
The buffet, which is included is bad. There is not so much to choose from and it has a bland taste.
For kids or adults with a sugartooth there is icecream for them to enjoy.

Went to this place with low expectations as I've grown cautious of lower-priced all you can eat sushi buffets. However, this place had great sushi, with all sorts of variety along with a small alternative non-sushi buffet on the side( which I did not try). At 200dkk per person, this place is one of the cheapest and it is definitely good! Drinks are pricey but they have a free-flowing drinks offer as well.

Service was slow but it was running sushi so not something you'd mind.

The price for buffet is not so expensive as well as the quality of food. It was not bad, but the service was awful! Our waitress was very slow, she hardly understood us and she add gratuity for the party of 4, but the rules saying that it should be party of 6. We won't visit this place for the second time.

Well prepared and delicately presented sushi in many tasty variations.
Nice staff and quiet atmosphere. 
Easy to get a reservation. 
A nice place to bring kids.

I don't usually eat burgers, but I felt like eating a real burger. I have never heard of Chicago Burger before, but reviews were favorable, so I decided to try it.

Everything was still new, clean, and impeccable. I like the decorations on the wall. They capture the "magical time" of the 50s and early 60s in America.

The Burger:
I am from New Jersey, so I requested the New Jersey burger and it was de-lic-ious and dripping with taste. Exactly what I needed.

The fries:
I can see that the menu fries had a paprika/barbecue flavored powered on it... they were OK. Maybe I would get a different kind of fries next time.

The shake:
All the shakes use strawberry, which I thought was strange. I don't remember strawberry in Real American Shakes... but I decided to try the Oreo shake anyway. It was so good. The presentation was great and the strawberry flavor was very low key. But it was reasonably thick and delicious. After eating a burger and fries, it was nice to share this shake with my wife.

We needed a quick dinner before driving home and went to Cafe A.
The place looked nice and clean, and we both went for the American dish chicken parmesan, which we had only heard about and never tasted  
Normally you get your drinks right after the order is placed, and the food didn't come very fast, so my fiance had to move the car to another parking spot.
The dish looked great at first glance, we were evited to taste this but...
I can't imagine, that Americans eat it like this.
It seemed like 4-5 pieces of chicken nuggets had been fried and placed on the plate along with spaghetti and topped with a storebought tomato sauce and a whole lot of cheddar(?)
It didn't taste like it had ever seen parmesan, the "crispy chicken" might have been crispy, but after a tomato sauce bath, they were mushy and gooey.
If that's chicken parmesan, I'm never having it again. What a disappointment.
We wanted to pay to get out, bit it were difficult to catch the attention of the waiters. Some people even went to the cashier to be able to pay and get out.
It helped a bit on the mood, that the dishes was 50% off, but it didn't make the taste better.
And "don't worry", if the you food is cheap, you pay a lot for the drinks instead.
I would not recommend this place.

We have also noticed that comparing to the other guests obviously having the same special menu, our main course was missing ingredients (green peas). When being done dining I have kindly pointed on the fact that there was a long hair in my food. Our waitress just looked at the hair, took it and walked away with it without saying a word. Then we have paid and due to this unacceptable attitude we do not intend come back or recommend this restaurant. I am still shocked that there was not even a word of apology from their side after me having a hair in my main course.

Well i had no expectations as it is in the middle of a popular ‚Äútheme park‚Äù all I wanted was something other other than burgers.

We ordered the steak and the goat-cheese sandwiches on a nice salat and the food was good.  The meat was prepared perfectly and the salad on our mains and the goat-cheese salats were very fresh.

I have a thing for goat cheese and this was perfect and can recommend it.

Finally the beautiful surroundings were romantic.  We came in from the side and didn‚Äôt see any good seating but when we went out the front there was small 4 person seating areas embedded in the bushes.  It was perfect!

Salad in sandwiches wasn‚Äôt cleaned!

We had pretty low expectations for the food at this cafe, but we were surprised how good the food was. Especially the tapas board, amazing.

I visited Egeskov castle for the Christmas markets with two friends, we arrived at lunch time so went to the cafe for a quick meal 

There were only two empty tables, so it was busy, the queue wasn‚Äôt that long though and as we were all non Danish I went first so I could see if ordering in English was ok 

Fortunately the server understood me and I ordered a salmon sandwich and a coffee, which is a help yourself black only from a machine type of coffee, for the price that was a bit rubbish 
Plus you have to ask for milk, which as he‚Äôd moved on took a few minutes 

I got a buzzer to say when my sandwich was ready (made to order ?) and sat down, with a piece of cake for after  

The ladies ordered the same and joined me 

Ten minutes later there buzzer went off and they collected their sandwiches 

Ten more minutes and I decided to ask a rough time for mine, I got served before them .. same sandwich 
I explained this made no sense but was told ‚Äúwe are busy‚Äù

I ate the cake .. 

Five more minutes and my buzzer buzzed, I went to collect my lunch and joined five other people, buzzers in hand and one stressed chef trying to give food to the right people 

The second server was busy arguing about overcharging a customer, which rightly or wrongly he gave up and refunded 

The only reason for a 3 star is the sandwich was one of the best I‚Äôve ever eaten, warm bread, tasty filling and massive

The prices are high (Denmark) here, maybe hire some more help or plan better for the fact there was a Christmas event on

Refreshing and different roadside restaurant. Looks very nice inside, and the pictures of the dishes are great. I had high hopes when I ordered......, but they did not deliver. I ordered a burger. Should be straight forward, but everything about it, apart from the presentation was a disappointment. The bun tasted nothing, the burger was bland, to much cheese, soggy relishy vegetable mash with no flavour. Chips were crisp. Overpriced...

Ok road side menu,
Overpriced and addition charging deposit on the bottles bought in the the restaurant without informing about this additional (not expected) charge.

adding another dkr 10 ( euro 1,40 ) for ketchup til the french fries.

Unfriendly staff trying to push sales of the over priced dips etc.

All in all a very sad experience with a feeling of being cheated.

I'm under no illusions as to what this place is, but I was still disappointed.

I ordered rissoles with hashed potatoes. I felt the price tag was above what I would pay myself, but I could foot the bill to the company.

When I got my food, it looked like they had taken a plate directly from the freezer and heated it in the micro.
I don't think I'm too far off, the rissoles were still cold (near frozen) in the center.

Very sub-standard and certainly not value for money. I would struggle to find an argument that would make me stop here again.

Going a place like this shouldn't surprise anyone. Food is average and prize is relatively high. They know it, and they know that's the only choice you've got when driving on the motorway. Had a cheeseburger - nothing to cheer about with that. Very average. Compared to what you get prize is in the high end. Anything on the side is extra, extra, extra. Pay, pay, pay...
